column4: yes i need help my grafics on my ubuntu 10.04 computer look blurry i think it is because of the video driver can some one help me
well u need to tell everyone what video card it is
i found the command and this is the video card Intel Corporation System Controller Hub (SCH Poulsbo) Graphics Controller (rev 07)

yikes.. unfortunately that card isn't very well supported at least according to this "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/System_Controller_Hub" .. perhaps there's bleeding edge code from intel.com if you're lucky..
can you please help me get it out of low graphics mode please
impossible.
there's no support for it.
there's a ppa for it.. but it's risky.. (add-apt-repository ppa:gma500/emgd) (sudo apt-get install xorg-emgd emgd-dkms emgd-xorg-conf)
i got those commands from a french ubuntu wiki
thanks ill try it
as i said it's bleeding edge.. it can do anything like randomly freeze ur system or something..
(remember i said its risky)
if i upgrade to 11.04 will it fix it
site source is http://doc.ubuntu-fr.org/poulsbo
if u're trying it.. also there's (emgd-xorg-conf) command to fire up..
this is dual boot with windows so i am safe just tell me what might work
it's getting more support as of 2.6.39.. so hope is not lost if you don't have it working yet..
well most u can do is uninstall the driver.. and go back to slow graphics.. nothing seriously will get damaged...
if i upgrade to 11.04 will that help
but if u decide to try a bleeding edge kernel then you have to make sure grub boots it up and everything else works too afterwards (like sound etc)
well i thought u were on 11.04.. so that site mentions 11.04..
u can try upgrading to 11.04.. then afterwards add the ppa for the driver..
see if everything works before trying the ppa
when i upgrade do i go into the unity or classic gnome
